item.title: Versioning R model objects in SQL Server
item.description: High-level info If you build a model and never update it you’re missing a trick. Behaviours change so your model will tend to perform worse over time. You’ve got to regularly refresh it, whether that’s adjusting the existing model to fit the latest data (recalibration) or building a whole new model (retraining), but this means you’ve got new versions of your model that you have to handle. You need to think about your methodology for versioning R model objects, ideally before you lose any versions.
